thread.title: Man City 5-1 Huddersfield player ratings: Raheem Sterling is rampant as Citizens book place in FA Cup quarter-finals
thread.title_full: Man City 5-1 Huddersfield player ratings: Raheem Sterling is rampant as Citizens book place in FA Cup quarter-finals

author: David McDonnell
title: Man City 5-1 Huddersfield player ratings: Raheem Sterling is rampant as Citizens book place in FA Cup quarter-finals
text:
Raheem Sterling was on form for Manchester City (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Raheem Sterling made two assists and hassled the Huddersfield defence all evening in Manchester City's 5-1 win in the FA Cup fourth-round replay. 
The Citizens had to come from behind on Wednesday night, when former club graduate Harry Bunn put the away team ahead in just seven minutes. 
But Sterling picked out Leroy Sane on the half-hour mark, who tapped home from close-range, before Sergio Aguero made it 2-1 from the penalty spot. 
Pablo Zabaleta scored City's third just before the break and Aguero, set up by Sterling, grabbed his team's fourth on 73 minutes. Kelechi Iheanacho scored the fifth in extra time. 
Here are David McDonnell's complete player ratings: Leroy Sane scores Man City's first goal (Photo: REUTERS) Manchester City 
Calamity keeper struck again, allowing the ball through his legs for the opener. 
Zabaleta 6 
Failed to intercept ball in build-up to opener. Atoned with City's third goal. 
Stones 6 
Did little wrong on the night but was hardly put under any pressure. 
Otamendi 6 
Played Bunn onside for the opener. Made amends by winning penalty for second goal. Harry Bunn scores the opener for Huddersfield (Photo: REUTERS) 
Clichy 6 
With little to do defensively, was allowed to push forward and attack. 
Fernandinho 6 
Went close early on with a goal-bound shot that deflected over the bar. 
Garcia 6 
Handed a rare start and played with diligence, without ever exciting. 
Sterling 8 MOTM 
Set up Sane for the equaliser and tormented Huddersfield throughout. Sergio Aguero celebrates with Leroy Sane (Photo: Getty) 
De Bruyne 7 
Tested Coleman with two fine free-kicks and controlled the midfield. 
Sane 8 
Hit post early on with fierce angled drive and plundered City's leveller. 
Aguero 8 
Scored from the spot for his 21 goal of the season and made City's third. Fernandinho wins a header for City (Photo: Getty) Huddersfield 
Made some routine saves but was well beaten for all of the City goals. 
Cranie 4 
Had a night to forget, trying to deal with the livewire talent of Sane. 
Stankovic 3 
Survived two penalty shouts but not a third when he bundled Otamendi over. 
Hudson 4 Booked 
Cautioned for a foul on Aguero. Struggled to cope with City's attack. Kevin De Bruyne on the ball (Photo: Getty) 
Holmes-Dennis 4 
Given a torrid time by the quick feet and movement of Sterling down his side. 
Lolley 6 
His surging run from out wide led to Hudderfield's shock opening goal. 
Whitehead 5 
The veteran midfielder was another who was overwhelmed in midfield 
Billing 6 
Funnelled the ball through to Bunn for the opener but faded thereafter. Sane comes close for the Citizens (Photo: Getty) 
Payne 5 
Forced a save from Bravo that drew ironic cheers from the keeper's own fans. 
Bunn 6 
Former City youngster opened the scoring with a shock goal against old club. 
Quaner 5 
Cut an isolated figure up front but persisted when chances came his way. 
Subs: 
La Parra 5 (Bunn, 54) 
Smith 5 (Lolley, 60) Will Manchester City win the FA Cup this season? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
